intro: Vernonia poskeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Vernonia poskeana is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an important part of the local flora.
